title: PerBlue Entertainment
description: My current role at PerBlue is a Front End / Engine Software developer. The most well known shipped product I've developed at PerBlue Entertainment is Disney Heroes: Battle Mode. I am also working on an unnanounced project!

title: Roboxing
description: Roboxing was a project developed for a physical arcade cabinet outside of the Husky Game Development lab. It also has a release on my itch.io (https://tyler-eichten.itch.io/)

title: Loot Force
description: This was an experimental project where I learned how to use Steam's networking API and develop a turn based hacking strategy game.

title: Barnout
description: Barnout is a 2-4 player party game I developed as a sophomore with a team for the Husky Game Development enterprise at Michigan Tech. I developed the front end and UX code in Unity as well as the graphics. Available at https://huskygames.com/games/?game=barnout

title: Siege of Arrolith
description: Siege of Arrolith is a 2-4 player turn based combat game I developed as a freshmen with a team for the Husky Game Development enterprise at Michigan Tech. I developed the front end and UX code in Java. Available at https://huskygames.com/games/?game=siege-of-arrolith

title: BOSS Snowplow | Web Design
description: As part of my internship, I was tasked with designing an internal web app capable of sending and receiving data similar to the old version, all while giving it a makeover. Created with Adobe Illustrator, Angular 4, Typescript, CSS3, HTML5, and ASP.Net/C#.

title: Creative Suite 155 | Graphic Design
description: These are several posters and materials I designed while on my on-campus job. Created with Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop, and Adobe InDesign.
